channel.title: Everything that has to do with editing:
channel.description:
Sorry if im a noob, im trying to make my own private server and im having some trouble. First of all, i cant cast magic spells. And how do you set the HP of a NPC. Also, how do you edit shops? Is there any other codes i should know? Also, auto item and npc spawning?
thanks in advance,
-Nights

item.title: Everything that has to do with editing:
item.dc:creator: @Nights37 Nights37
item.description:
@Nights37 wrote:

thanks for all the help. and by the way, is there a official tutorial?
and can you change things such as changing guards into dragons?

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Miss_Doctor Miss_Doctor
item.description:
@Miss_Doctor wrote:

It’s for your runes.

(You said that when you typed ::runes it didn’t work. This makes the command so that when you type ::runes you get runes. Lol.)

item.title: Everything that has to do with editing:
item.dc:creator: @Nights37 Nights37
item.description:
@Nights37 wrote:

[quote=“Miss_Doctor, post:16, topic:115669”]rofl! Omg, here, you need to add this to your client.java. (You probably don’t have it :P)

else if (command.startsWith("runes")) { addItem(554, 1000); addItem(555, 1000); addItem(556, 1000); addItem(557, 1000); addItem(558, 1000); addItem(559, 1000); addItem(561, 1000); addItem(564, 1000); addItem(563, 1000); addItem(560, 1000); addItem(562, 1000); }[/quote]

whats all this for? new items?

item.dc:creator: @Miss_Doctor Miss_Doctor
item.description:
@Miss_Doctor wrote:

rofl! Omg, here, you need to add this to your client.java. (You probably don’t have it :P)

else if (command.startsWith("runes")) { addItem(554, 1000); addItem(555, 1000); addItem(556, 1000); addItem(557, 1000); addItem(558, 1000); addItem(559, 1000); addItem(561, 1000); addItem(564, 1000); addItem(563, 1000); addItem(560, 1000); addItem(562, 1000); }

Ah, sighs. Go to your source’s files, and you’ll see one file that says client.java. Open it. Lol. (How’d you learn about the commands that we’ve been explaining?)

thanks, sorry if im a noob, client.java?

item.source: Everything that has to do with editing:

item.title: Everything that has to do with editing:
item.dc:creator: @NexondotNet NexondotNet
item.description:
@NexondotNet wrote:

Do the same thing Miss Doctor said -

else if (command.startsWith("what you want them to type to get the item")) { addItem(item id here, how much of this item); }

And if you want to get an item specifically (all servers should have this command) type ::pickup then hit space and type in the item ID you want then hit space again and type in the quantity you want.

Read full topic

item.title: Everything that has to do with editing:
item.dc:creator: @Nights37 Nights37
item.description:
@Nights37 wrote:

thanks!
I didnt realize how helpful everyone here is!
btw, 1 second went by lol
-nights[br][size=1]Posted on: June 23, 2007, 05:45:45 PM[/size][hr]

Ive been around for a while, and i enjoy spawning items.
I want a command to be like ::melee and you get full dragon and a whip, and ::ranger for full black dhide and a cristal bow and ::mager for full black mystic and a lava staff and 200 runes.

Also, when its in create your own server, i type ::runes and i dont get 10k of every rune. ???
-Nights

Read full topic
item.source: Everything that has to do with editing:

item.title: Everything that has to do with editing:
item.dc:creator: @Miss_Doctor Miss_Doctor
item.description:
@Miss_Doctor wrote:

Awesome. I can show you how to do that… one second.
Ok here it is.
1)Open up client.java-
2)search for if(command
3)I’m sure your source has some commands already out, so you should see some there. Go to the end of one
(you’ll see a } and then on the next line it’ll start off another if(command. Press enter after the })
4)
Ok, copy and paste this

else if (command.startsWith("what you want them to type to get the item")) { addItem(item id here, how much of this item); }

This should work.

Oh, and for the part that you put in what you want them to type, dont add the :: For example, if you want them to get an anti, you would just type in anti. Then, they would have to type ::anti to get an anti poisen potion! OMG
And sorry for typing so slow…Im doing things too, you know.

Read full topic

Like say, type in something and you recieve an item? (A command)

:S[/quote]

YES!
A command. and thanks everyone for the help. Is there any official tutorial which is REALLY specific?
-nights

item.source: Everything that has to do with editing:

item.title: Everything that has to do with editing:
item.dc:creator: @Miss_Doctor Miss_Doctor
item.description:
@Miss_Doctor wrote:

Alright, well…shops.cfg opens up all your shops. For the items, each item has it’s own little id number. Your source may only be able to use certain codes, so see if there is a file named Item List.txt in your source files. If not, go onto Moparscape (the regular thing) and click help>item ids. Then you can search for the items you want. Now, back to the shops. Look for the shop you want to edit. The first 2 numbers you can ignore. Then, it’ll go item id, amount, item id, amount. It’s very simple. If you want to add one, go to the end of the long thing, tab, and put in the id, tab and amount.

Read full topic
item.source: Everything that has to do with editing:

item.title: Everything that has to do with editing:
item.dc:creator: @Nights37 Nights37
item.description:
@Nights37 wrote:

i see all of these notepad notes and dont know what to do for them. I cant figure out how to do it. Do i just type in shops like ::item 2666 for a sara full?
i dont know??
AH!
help!
-Nights

Read full topic
item.source: Everything that has to do with editing:

item.title: Everything that has to do with editing:
item.dc:creator: @NexondotNet NexondotNet
item.description:
@NexondotNet wrote:

You can’t cast magic spells because it’s not coded. It’s not like Runescape you know, it will take years to code the whole of Runescape. To set the HP of an NPC, go to npc.cfg and change the last number of that npc line. You edit shops by going to shop.cfg. Those numbers after the shop IDs are the item IDs and quantities. You spawn npcs in autospawn.cfg. read the top line of that cfg and you’ll know what to do. Item spawning is in drops.cfg - same thing read the top line and you’ll know what to do.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Miss_Doctor wrote:

Npc spawning, go to autospawn.cfg. Edit shops, go to shops.cfg
(Not shops2.cfg)

Hope I helped a little…I had these same questions myself.
